Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of RAD's analysis of Internal Flight Alternative (IFA)
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's lack of connections or safety in Tirana
Decision_Outcome: RPD denied claim, RAD upheld decision
Legal_Rule: RAD must apply a reasonableness standard when reviewing RPD decisions on questions of fact or mixed fact and law
Procedural_Issue: RAD failed to address key evidence regarding undue hardship
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to abuse by father
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim denied based on alleged available IFA in Tirana
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RAD did not properly assess IFA, raising procedural fairness concerns
Key_Evidence_Considered: Lack of familial or social connections in Tirana
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to RAD's failure to meaningfully assess IFA
Court_Result: Judicial review granted, case remitted to differently constituted RAD panel
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on standard of review
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of RAD decision, remittal for new hearing
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under the Federal Courts Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Principles of administrative law on reasonableness
